reviews.text: Five minutes from town on a pond and across from the Brasilian border, this hostel attracts more rugged travelers.
reviews.title: Not great, not horrible

reviews.text: Beds are comfortable and clean, but would be nice if the pillows were a bit thicker -- a problem throughout Colombia, I would add.
reviews.title: A haven in the jungle literally 5 minutes walk from town

reviews.text: One thing I found that was really weird was that there was an infant child staying in the dormitory. Yes, really. After a while, the mother shared the bed with the child, but I think it is irresponsible of management to allow young children in a dormitory for adults. Very strange...and poor decision on behalf of management.
reviews.title: Nice place with unfriendly Management

reviews.text: There's a bit of a hard sell on purchasing tours through the hostel, but this is to be expected at this kind of property, and the intent is very transparent.
reviews.title: Mahatu is a peaceful oasis in the chaos that is Leticia proper!

reviews.text: We stayed at Mahatu guesthouse after being recommended from a chap at the airport. We live in the jungle in North Queensland, Australia. Therefore we are well used to all the native bugs & beetles that come with it & know how difficult it can be to keep them out of your kitchen, bathroom & living areas. After all you are in the Amazing Amazon!
reviews.title: So relaxing!
